original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close down on low investor sentiment
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed down on Monday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was down 0.45 percent, or 46.91 points, at 10,480.
The S&P SL20 index was up 0.38 percent, or 11.46 points, at 2,970.
Turnover was at 579 million. The banks sector (215mn) and food beverage and tobacco sector contributed mainly (121mn).
Market participants said investor sentiment remained low due to some doubts about the second tranche of an IMF bailout.
The CSE approved in principle an application for listing the debt securities of Commercial Bank of Ceylon Plc (up at 85.30).

The top five positive contributors to the ASPI were Cargills (Ceylon) Plc (up at 369.75), LOLC Holdings Plc (up at 375.75), Melstacorp Plc (up at 77.50), and Carson Cumberbatch Plc (up at 255.00). (Colombo/Nov27/2023). (Colombo/Nov27/2023)
